TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
> 
> \*Goes to check all of Kuzzter's posts\*

I saw he asked something about Runway numbers "for a friend" in Gameplay questions.

Maybe that's the thing?

> 
> I saw he asked something about Runway numbers "for a friend" in Gameplay questions.
> Maybe that's the thing?

I'm compiling a list of suspicious posts in the last two pages of his posting history.

- - - Updated - - -

This is all I could find that seemed related.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today?p=2262624&viewfull=1#post2262624](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today?p=2262624&viewfull=1#post2262624)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/137738-Runways?p=2265288&viewfull=1#post2265288](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/137738-Runways?p=2265288&viewfull=1#post2265288)

> 
> There it's a big hole in the probe theory. The ssto has a cockpit

Not that hard to use the flat okto at the front and put a cockpit behind it and then put the klaw on top. It would be pretty well hidden if you didn't look closely.

The first part of the interlude really doesn't seem to have much to do with the second part:

Last page of interlude PT1:

![dRa99Kf.png](http://i.imgur.com/dRa99Kf.png)

First page of interlude PT2:

![WuC062t.png](http://i.imgur.com/WuC062t.png)

I don't think Mort's behind the kill kerbals idea, unless it's an alternate reality where contracts are offered for killing kerbals.

I think Parkaboy finally perfected mind control and has hijacked Eve:Order Zero via Kuzzter's brain. How else could the drastic increase in drama be explained?

Plus Kenlie sounds a lot like Parkaboy's kerbals do in Plan Kappa monologues.

Oh no what have I done. IT WAS THE RUNWAY! THE RUNWAAAAAAYYYYYY!!!!1! I couldn't bear you all going all tinfoil crazy on the meaning of '27' so I posted that one question "for a friend" so that SOMEBODY here would realize the Evil SSTO took off going WEST not EAST. I mean that one poor guy had to create an account it was getting so ridiculous!

\*deepbreath\*

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-29T13:51:38Z" title="10/29/2015 01:51  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 29, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**
You have made me scour all of the posts from now on for hidden clues and such. I am paranoid now.

So does this reveal that Mortimer is covering up the fact that there is some ship up there killing kerbals to be rescued, or is Mortimer unaware of this taking place, and is assuming that Gemmane will be rescued successfully?
I, for one, am looking forward to the G.R.I.N.D. I want to see how Mort's plan will turn out!
The interlude name text is different! Also, note: Gemmane *Kerman,* not Kermulan. Did the last part of the interlude happen in another star system?

I hope they don't abandon the Kerbals astronauts.

Idea for a plot: Mortimer *does* get the astronauts nearly fired, but fails because during a test mission to the Mun, the new A.I., the K-5 Supercomputer Probe Core, jeopardized the crew of several other spacecraft. The K-5 Supercomputer Probe Core is retired, and the United Kerbin Space Probe Agency continues to use astronauts after all. Bonus points if Dr Richard Kermstrom breaks down into tears at this failure.

The Ultimate Kerputer.

> 
> I hope they don't abandon the Kerbals astronauts.
> Idea for a plot: Mortimer *does* get the astronauts nearly fired, but fails because during a test mission to the Mun, the new A.I., the K-5 Supercomputer Probe Core, jeopardized the crew of several other spacecraft. The K-5 Supercomputer Probe Core is retired, and the United Kerbin Space Probe Agency continues to use astronauts after all. Bonus points if Dr Richard Kermstrom breaks down into tears at this failure.
> 
> The Ultimate Kerputer.

And Jeb has to talk it to death over the radio.

> 
> And Jeb has to talk it to death over the radio.

While trying to land an airplane because he's the only one who didn't eat fish for dinner.

27 and 9.

**270** and **90.** Headings, east and west. The "evil" SSTO was taking off West because mumble mumble [CP-symmetry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CP_violation) mumble mumble

Either way, looking forward to Chapter 9!

You should stagger releases with Parkaboy so we don't go through withdrawal ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
**Wait: new theory incoming:** *What if-* ***There is no conspiracy? No spaceplane? No killing? What if this is*** **ALL KENLIE'S IMAGINATION?----** End Transmission

>

Simply a wonderful bit of interlude, Kuzzter.

Many laughs, but, more importantly, a clue!

Happy landings!
